questions.question: Minimum number of AND, OR and NOT gates required in a 4- bit BCD to Excess-3 converter circuit is _____________.

explanations.a: The minimized logic implementation of a 4-bit BCD to Excess-3 converter typically requires 4 AND gates, 4 OR gates, and 3 NOT gates.

answers.a: A line is permanently stuck to ground.
answers.b: A line is permanently stuck to Vdd.
answers.c: A line is permanently stuck to another line.

explanations.b: A stuck-at-1 fault means the line is always at logic high (1), which corresponds to being permanently connected to Vdd.

questions.question: The output ‘Y’ of the following AND gate when B is 0 and 1 are respectively

explanations.d: If the other input to the AND gate is 1, then when B = 0, output Y = 0; and when B = 1, Y = 1.

questions.question: The BCD code of a number is 0111 0001 1000. The Excess-3 code of this number is (assuming no stuck at faults) are

explanations.c: Adding 3 (0011) to each BCD digit (0111, 0001, 1000) gives the corresponding Excess-3 code as 1010, 0100, 1011.

questions.question: The advantage of Excess-3 code over BCD code is that

answers.b: Excess 3 code is a self-complementing code.

explanations.b: Excess-3 code is self-complementing, meaning the complement of a number in Excess-3 is obtained by simply inverting the bits.
